zipkin

Interface TraceIdSampler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoundaryTraceIdSampler, CountingTraceIdSampler

    public interface TraceIdSampler
    TraceIdSampler decides if a particular trace ID should be "sampled".

    For instrumentation, this decides whether the overhead of tracing will occur and/or if a trace will be reported to the collection tier. The instrumentation sampling decision happens once, at the root of the trace, and is propagated downstream. For this reason, the decision needn't be consistent based on trace ID.

    For collectors, this is a major input to the decision of whether a trace will be written to storage. Unlike instrumentation, collector's tracing decision needs to be consistent across nodes. For this reason, the implementation must be consistent on trace ID.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static TraceIdSampler ALWAYS_SAMPLE 
      static TraceIdSampler NEVER_SAMPLE 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isSampled(long traceId)
      Returns true if a trace should be measured.

    • Field Detail

      • ALWAYS_SAMPLE

        static final TraceIdSampler ALWAYS_SAMPLE

      • NEVER_SAMPLE

        static final TraceIdSampler NEVER_SAMPLE

    • Method Detail

      • isSampled

        boolean isSampled(long traceId)
        Returns true if a trace should be measured.

        Zipkin v1 instrumentation uses before-the-fact sampling. This means that the decision to keep or drop the trace is made before any work is measured, or annotations are added. As such, the input parameter to zipkin v1 samplers is the trace ID (64-bit random number).
